transcript.title: FOR PRESS: P.M. NO. 3/1966 - NEW DEPUTY COMMISIONER IN THE UNITED KINGDOM - STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER, SIR ROBERT MENZIES
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS -1I. No, 3/ 1966
NEWI DEPUTY HIGH COM14ISSIONER 1. TI UNITED KINGDOM
Statement by the Prime Minister, Sir Robert Menzies
The Secretary of the -Department of Supply, Mr.
J. L. Knott, has been appointed Deputy High Commissioner
for Australia in the United Kingdom.
The new Deputy High Commissioner will take up his
post in London shortly, succeeding Sir Allen Brown,
who is now Australian Ambassador to Japan.
In offering this appointment to Mr. Knott, tne
Government took the opportunity of expressing its admiration
for hia outstandingly successful work as Secretary of the
Department of Supply during the past six years. In that time
the Department has had to deal with a number of important
developments in the scientific and defence fields. L: 1r. Knott
has led the Department most capably, and on his record the
Government has full confidence in appointing Lir. Knott to this
important position in London.
CAI BERRA,
7th January, 1966.
